about_the_game:
From]: John
Subject: Bubbaruka

Hey, it's been a little bit!

I know it's a bit strange for me to Email you out of the blue, but I thought you'd be interested in this. You remember that old toy? The one that was supposed to be like a pet in your keychain? The one that never got released?

Well I found it.

I was just cruising around eBay, and I found a super cheap laptop for sale. The owner acted real weird, refused to take phone calls, only let me talk to him via Email. But you know, cheap product cheap service.

Turns out the laptop had something in it already, a folder called Bubbaruka.

The name jogged so many memories, I remember begging my mom to get me one for Christmas. Never knew why they didn't release them. They would've made tons.

But It's here! Seems fully functioning, just like the commercials! I didn't start much, I rushed to Email you first. I know you're into lost media, missing games, that sort of thing. This is right up your alley, right? Still, It's a bit buggy. It definitely seems unfinished, and some of the features straight up don't seem to work, but it's a fun nostalgia trip.

Welp, I'm gonna go play the game for like, 30 minutes before I get bored and forget it exists. Talk to you later!

Attached: Bubbaruka.zip

This is the Demo for the game Bubbaruka. Visit the main Steam Page to see more details



This demo contains the first Bubby's section in it's entirety, making for roughly 40 minutes of gameplay.

Features

  • 2D Retro Graphics
  • Cast of cute playable characters
  • Two endings + Plenty of secrets to uncover
  • Intense first person horror segments
  • Ghoulish creatures stalking your every turn
  • A hidden story that beckons you deeper into the game

content_descriptors.notes: Contains depictions of cartoon violence, swearing, animated bloodshed, and intense situations.

detailed_description:
From]: John
Subject: Bubbaruka

Hey, it's been a little bit!

I know it's a bit strange for me to Email you out of the blue, but I thought you'd be interested in this. You remember that old toy? The one that was supposed to be like a pet in your keychain? The one that never got released?

Well I found it.

I was just cruising around eBay, and I found a super cheap laptop for sale. The owner acted real weird, refused to take phone calls, only let me talk to him via Email. But you know, cheap product cheap service.

Turns out the laptop had something in it already, a folder called Bubbaruka.

The name jogged so many memories, I remember begging my mom to get me one for Christmas. Never knew why they didn't release them. They would've made tons.

But It's here! Seems fully functioning, just like the commercials! I didn't start much, I rushed to Email you first. I know you're into lost media, missing games, that sort of thing. This is right up your alley, right? Still, It's a bit buggy. It definitely seems unfinished, and some of the features straight up don't seem to work, but it's a fun nostalgia trip.

Welp, I'm gonna go play the game for like, 30 minutes before I get bored and forget it exists. Talk to you later!

Attached: Bubbaruka.zip

This is the Demo for the game Bubbaruka. Visit the main Steam Page to see more details



This demo contains the first Bubby's section in it's entirety, making for roughly 40 minutes of gameplay.

Features

  • 2D Retro Graphics
  • Cast of cute playable characters
  • Two endings + Plenty of secrets to uncover
  • Intense first person horror segments
  • Ghoulish creatures stalking your every turn
  • A hidden story that beckons you deeper into the game
name: Bubbaruka! Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Any
  • Processor: Any
  • Graphics: Any
  • Storage: 800 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Any
  • Additional Notes: Low intensity, any Windows device will work.

short_description: A horror puzzle demo about exploring an abandoned children's game, stalked by the the shambling husks of scrapped concepts that pursue you endlessly throughout the environment as you try to solve the cryptic puzzles left behind by the developers and keep your pet alive.
